intro: Dombeya pilosa var. globigera, commonly known as the globigera dombeya, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats.
